intro: Oenothera hookeri var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its slender, angular stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces showy yellow to orange flowers that open in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in desert or arid environments. Oenothera hookeri var. angustifolia is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes other evening primroses and related species.
